intro: Eriocaulon perpusillum, commonly known as the tiny sedge, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces tiny, three-lobed seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
